description: The pizzas here are pretty good. I like their "The Works" pizza. One thing to note though, the guy who helped me was tossing some dough. Then he ringed me up, touch some money and put the money in the cash register. He said thanks and wipe his hands on his apron and went back to tossing the dough. Well, the dough will be cooked anyways, and any germs will be killed. Please wash your hands next time.
author: Jeff H.

description: Don't order delivery from here. They made a mistake of thinking order was pick up (even though I ordered through the app for delivery). Made me wait 2 hrs and when I called second time to check what's going on they did the exact same thing LOL where they made a new pizza and left it there thinking it's pick up AGAIN. No compensation what so ever. They don't care about customers
author: Sean H.

description: Normally I don't review chains, but this place is an exception. Been here many times, due to the place being close to SFSU, and their tuesdays, buy 1 pizza, get another one free, for any size deal. Lots of pizza variety, and their garlic parmesan breadsticks, garlic knots, cheesesticks, its it ice cream (vanilla, cappuccino, and mint flavors), and cinnamon pull ups are all good. Their wings are also good too, but they're a bit more expensive. They have many different sauces they can provide you, such as buffalo, nacho cheese, pizza sauce, honey mustard, etc. My top favorite pizza still is the buffalo chicken. For a pizza chain, the buffalo sauce is good, the chicken is tender, bacon is good, overall, its pretty tasty! (you cant beat the buy one get one free deal)
author: Kyle H.

description:
Hair baked in the pizza when delivered.

Ordered a medium pizza for delivery. Came on time and was hot. However there was a large black hair baked into the pizza toppings. Forever unclean
author: Mischa S.

description: Customer service is asscrack, dudes need a education asap
author: Tomson L.

description: We are furiously upset with this lousy pizza. $30.00 worth and pizza is ridiculous bad, its burnth and with a comparison of homemade pizza looks way better than this pathetic pizza. This location is awful. I can't even concentrate writing this review due of anger and felt taken  advantage on how lousy this pizza is.
author: Jefferson E.

description: As good as a papa johns can get. Never had any problems ordering online. Usually make my pizza within 15 minutes of ordering and it's always turned out pretty good. Service is decent. Not the most friendly but they get the job done. Never had any problems with my orders. Plenty of parking in the front and easy to drive to.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Ordered pizza and wings from their store on state road 16 in st Augustine.  got bad food poisoning.  when I contacted the store I was told I would get a call back from the manager.  never happened.  then called corporate. they is so many words said sorry about your luck.  I still get emails from them all the time and I still respond "Not interested in getting food poisoning again"  to date the manager has yet to call me and at least apologize for poor food control.  They could care less about there patrons.
author: John H.

description: I've never really had a bad experience. Staff is usually pretty nice to me. I normally order from this place when I get my free 1 topping medium pizza from T-Mobile. Online order and then I go pick it up. No waits, always ready when I get there. All I can say is, portion size is terrible. One would assume that they fill up the pizza. NOPE. You get like a sprinkle of toppings. It's like the bare minimum. (Though I can't complain when it's free I guess but still imagine if I were to pay...) The medium has about 8 slices. I liked the garlic butter that each pizza comes with. Definitely dipping my crust in that. Overall, no complaints other than how much toppings are in a 1 topping pizza.
author: Benita M.

description: I ordered a pizza from this store and the toppings that I had requested for were all missing. Also, we dont eat bacon and that was included. I called the person at the store and he was quite rude with me. I will not order pizza from this store.0
author: Sonia D.

description: Came in here to pick up my order and I was watching the guy in the back make pizza. His stomach was pouring over the dough... -.-
author: Annie Y.

description:
I am a teacher, and my class is writing this review with me as a lesson about reviews. We ordered for delivery from this Papa John's Pizza for our winter party. The kids' review begins here:

     We think that Papa John's pizza is so delicious and awesome! One reason is that there were breadsticks and they were chewy. We also ate pepperoni pizza, cheese pizza, and a John's Favorite pizza. Our favorite part was the pizza of course, but everyone also liked the breadsticks, too! One reason the pizza was good is because we like cheese, pepperoni, and sausage, and there were a lot of those ingredients on our pizzas. Some kids disagreed on how much sauce was on the pizza. Another reason the pizza was good is that it was hot when it got to our classroom, and it looked perfect! We also gave it four stars because they made it in time for lunch! The driver was right on time. This is important because it gave us more time for recess. 
     Here are some quotes from our class: 
Student L: "I thought the pizza was okay because I thought there was too much cheese and too much pepperoni but I liked the breadsticks." 
Student G: "The food was radical!"
Student J: "The food was delicious!"
Student P: "The pizza was so delicious I want to make my own pizza store and eat more." 
Student S: "The food was so good, I really want to eat some more." 
Student T: "The pizza was so delicious I want to go into this screen so I can eat more." 
Student K: "I like your pizza!" 
     Overall, most kids in class loved the pizza, but some of us thought there were better pizzas out there. It is on the top five pizza list for most kids in our class. Thank you for the pizza!
author: Natalie K.

description: Papa John never fails! In my time in LA I never really had pizza from here, but after moving to the Bay I rather prefer this place than pizza hut or dominoes.
author: Susan S.

description:
I live a few blocks from this Papa John's and have ordered from them once every month or two for almost two years. It's an easy dinner to pick up on the way home to feed the family or for delivery party food when no one is fit to drive. We're usually pretty happy with the quality -- it's not great, but it's cheap, so it works. We usually use the ear24 coupon to get 2 large pizzas for $26. 

Tonight, I ordered a pickup order, and with extra mouths to feed, I decided to get the 2 XL pizzas for $30. I put the order in when I left work, as per usual, but because of the rain and an accident on the freeway, I showed up 20 minutes after the estimated pickup time. 

Not only was the staff rude about me being late, but one of my XLs was only a large. It's not a huge loss, only a $2 difference, but it was frustrating.
author: Amelia T.

description:
Pizza was cold when delivered. 
They didn't provide any seasonings and flakes despite of adding in the order.
I asked for EXTRA SAUCE & WELL DONE pizza and it wasn't even DONE with very little sauce.
author: Abhijit P.

description: Man... everyone that ate the pizza got sick.... good thing I don't do pizza but I had to clean the puke up!  Not sure if it was the store or the delivery people from door dash....  done with both
author: Rob M.

description:
The typical chain of papa johns. The reason I come to this one is its proximity to my house. Easy to find parking. This is a larger location than most having two tables, one for two people the other for four. Clean for the most part, under the counter could use a good cleaning but everywhere else you look looks clean.
Pizza and bread sticks are standard fair for papa johns. So that means it's good!
author: Jesse S.

description:
This is not a place for you to order a pizza and hang out with friends. There are no tables for huge groups. I suppose a lot of college students order pizza here and grab some drinks at the market next-door for a good time with friends.

I came here this week with the coupon that offers a large pizza buy one get one free deal. 

I live less than 0.1 mile away from this restaurant and didn't like how they charge a four dollar delivery fee for such a short distance. But I suppose if they did not put a charge on this, then students would abuse the delivery. 

Their original crust is thick, very filling.
author: Danae L.

description: Came in last night and tonight and received an OUTSTANDING customer service by Brandon!
author: Julia C.

description: Worst customer service ever! One of the cashiers answered the phone i wanted to make an order and she just told me to wait i drive by the storeand i see her on the phone and manager doesnt tell her anything!
author: Portillo G.

description: Bad service multiple times ordering from this location and the order was wrong and had to wait longer that the delivery time
author: Nishelle T.

description:
I don't know what's going on with this specific Papa John's, but I've ordered from them twice and they've screwed it up both times. 

The first time it was really late, which to be fair to them, the manager called me and told me it would be. I was okay with waiting for delivery, but I was under the impression it would still be hot, fresh food. Instead, it was cold, congealed, and so gross I had to toss it. It was a waste of money.

The second time, I scheduled the delivery to be for 6:30. They came at 4:30, almost gave me the wrong soda (which he fixed when I pointed it out), and I wasn't given an option to reschedule or anything to fix the issue, so I was stuck with food I wasn't ready to eat. Why give the option to schedule for a later time if they don't pay attention to it?

The food itself was okay the second time around, at least. Not as gross as the first time. Just wasn't hungry yet.

I think I'll just be avoiding this specific PJ's from now on. Pizza is too expensive to risk more flubs from a place that doesn't seem to have its stuff together.
author: Daniella A.

description: I've ordered here a few times. The pizza always comes out good. Lot's of flavor. The customer service sucks though. I'd recommend if you're too lazy to cook.
author: Ray R.

description: Don't ever order from this sorry ass excuse for a pizza place unless you want to wait 3.5 hours for your pizza.
author: Eric C.

description: Today I ordered first time this restaurant from eat24 .my order is chicken vege thin pizza . I order about 6:00 pm and I wait until 7:45 but I don't found my order.when I called restaurant they don't receive my call . I wait to long time and I'm very hungry but food never get . I never order again poor and worst restaurant.
author: Krishna K.

description: I love the big bonanza. The ingredients are so fresh. And, the garlic sauce is excellent yumnness factor. Its like crack. Im addicted.
author: Selby C.

description:
DO NOT ORDER WITHOUT CHECKING OUT the specials. We ordered a medium pizza. With Tax, delivery and TIP $20.63. A medium was $13.98. I hung up. Then I clicked on SPECIALS,  and LOW AND BEHOLD 2 MEDIUM PIZZA'S FOR $13.99. Did they mention that for 1 PENNY we could get a second pizza? Nope.

To me that is a crappy way to run a business. I called back immediately and she said the driver had left.

Shame on you Papa Johns. I hope you choked on my $20 as hard as I did you pizza.

You lost a very good customer.
author: Julie Robins E.

description: The prices on the board and what you pay do not match and they say "the boards have not been updated". They touch the money and everything and go back there to make the pizza without gloves on. Other than that pizza was ok.
author: Dilan Ş.

description:
Today I picked up a pizza for a Postmates job and I had to wait a bit before it was ready. I was there for about 10 minutes and witnessed something pretty nasty.

One of the employees set the magnetic car topper for delivery vehicles on the counter where pizzas are made. Those things are disgusting and to put it on a counter where food is made? Thank god I wasn't picking up food for myself.

Also the employee who rang me up was the same person who was making pizzas. Didn't see him wash his hands either.

Beware of the food from here!
author: Robert C.

description: theyre rude they lost the contact info so then we couldnt get pizza which we paid $40 for so dont go here
author: Lindsey B.

description: Fast delivery on a busy night. Included plates and extra garlic butter sauce, one of the few Papa John's Pizza that does this! One of the better Papa John's I have ordered from!
author: Andrew S.

description:
You know people call me crazy for liking them, but I love their chicken and pepperoncini pizza. Love their crust and their sauce. Plus, there's mad coupons online so don't pay full price! 

Unlike the other local mom-and-pop type pizza places I've tried, this one actually delivers in a timely fashion. I swear one time I ordered and it got here in less than 15 minutes! I thought it would be an old pizza or was a mistake, but no! Fresh, hot pizza in my hands before I even finished my blunt! I tipped the dude $10 because that's how you handle a pizza place :)
author: Bruce W.

description:
This location has significantly decreased in quality. About 6 months + ago they seem to have replaced the entire staff. Ever since then, the customer service has been really poor and the pizza quality has dropped.

Plus, they charge a ridiculous "delivery" fee.
author: Dustin S.

description:
Pizza is ok here. But after at list 10 times I walked in and ask them do not park their delivery vehicles on the red line. They don't care! Sometimes hey park almost one yard from the curb, which makes difficult to enter to the Park Plaza shopping center. This community deserves better treatment!
UPDATE:After I drove to the ParkPlaza I noticed that one of the delivery personal just pulled over his car on a Red zone. I asked "Excuse me, I have a question". He said "Yes". Th n I asked my question: "Why you parked your car on the Red zone?". The person just turned around and walked away. No answer! So I parked my car and walked in to Papa John's Pizza . I assume that the driver told the story to the lady inside the store. But when I entered into the store and just said "Hello", the lady said "You can't come here with THAT attitude". I said that the only thing that I did was entering and saying "Hello". Than it came to laughable things that I wasn't the owner of the place and can't complain about delivery guys parking on the Red zone and I was harassing them and trespassing. So "Get out!". As law obeying citizen  I got out of the store. The manager, after about 5 times being asked for her name introduced herself as Olivia. The driver's name is unknown.
author: Ara A.

description:
I'm like reading the reviews*****

 To all the yelpers down below~~
I LOL at the peeps who are so rude to the employees here due to poor customer service and delivery. People like you are the reason why you make their jobs not enjoyable when they clock into work. Do ever consider that they can be under staff? Can't you get on a freakin bus(bus lines stops around 12am) and get your ass to Papa John's to pick up your order? Better than waiting 2 or 3 hours for delivery that's for sure!

I have no problem ordering online and then pick up at the store. Luckily for me I live a walking distance from there but even before I use to live at Ingelside taking the M line. I have no problem with the employees. They always have my orders right. If anything they are on point and busy. They never seem to take a break with all the special offers and stuff!

Pats to you Papa John's employees! Keep doing your thang!!
author: Hue H.

description: This place sucks! I ordered online said it'll take around 10-20 minutes! I come pick up my pizza and they said 25 more minutes!!!!! Waited the extra 25 minutes and NOTHING! An hour later, my order still isn't ready!!! They have the nerve to say it'll be ready in about 5 to 25 minutes!!! WTF!!!! Do NOT order from this place! Horrible!! OH! And while they're telling me my order is going to be done an extra 25 minutes late, the workers themselves are eating pizza and saving theirs on the side! Ridiculous!
author: Britney B.

description: Really Papa Johns?? You're gonna charge me extra just to request my anchovies be put on the side? You're gonna nickel n dime ur potential customer. You just lost this customer! Bad business!!
author: Quan H.

description: Bad customer service ! Ordered cheesy breadsticks and received plain ass dry ass breadsticks then when I called and asked them to deliver me the cheesy bread that I wanted the manager said I could come pick it up . I live close I shouldn't have to walk back up there because they fucked up
author: Ahlayah S.

description:
If i could give no stars i would!!!!!!!@!!!!!!
been waiting over an hour called the dumb asses up to find out my 5 xl pizzas are sitting on a counter getting cold because he says he has no driver.  yet a co worker of mine that ordered at the same time and had it sent to the same address has already gotten there pizza. 
if its going to the same place why the hell would you make two trips !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Never again and thats sad because ive order from this place alot now i will be giving my money to anyone but papa!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Makiki H.

description:
Worst Service!! 9:30pm  i called for Delivery and the gentleman on the phone was so rude!

I gave him the Address which is only 7 min away located in Daly City, and he said they don't deliver there! I tried to talk to him and he was being impolite and kept saying NO NO. Then i called the San Bruno Papa Johns and the nice gentleman behind the phone told me that they should deliver there and told me to call them again and tell them that its in their destination. So i called again tried to negotiate but still Very RUDE and Offensive Saying No then hung up. 

The 10 min away San Bruno Papa Johns ended up delivering for me which they weren't suppose to. It was nice of them! 

Bad experience, Never calling again!!
2/23/15
author: Zohan E.

description: Got some medium pizzas today-Hawaiian and pepperoni. I have always liked Papa John's recipe for pizza. The dough tastes good and I actually want to eat it. I recommend this over other pizza chains.
author: Denise C.

description:
papa johns is ok.. not too bad if you compared  to little Caesars and Costco pizzas.. but better then Domino's soggy Pizza..
For a $10 pizza you can't go bad.. the staff here most of the time is here to take your order and get you on your way.   Nothing special... they always have plenty of parking and you could always find a groupon / coupon deal.  
I gave it a 3 stars rating because I have a 5 star pizza place and a 4 star pizza place . Little Caesars Pizza would be like a 1 or 2 star in my rating book .. more like 1 and a half.  
pizza pizza  lol
author: ren M.

description:
Don't waste your time, they won't deliver on time and you'll be sitting around starving. 

I ordered through Seamless at around 3pm with a future delivery for 6pm. Got my confirmation email and they take the money from my credit card. 

6:15, we're hungry and in a bit of a rush because we have a flight to catch. 

Call this joke of a restaurant and ask them what's up. First girl is one of those people who don't listen to anything you say and then puts you on hold looking for who knows what because she didn't listen to you. 

Next lady asks for my number in broken english and says "we never got no order from this number EVER". 

OKAY. I reiterate that I ordered through seamless. OH. She sees the order and apologizes and says my pizza will be here in 30 min. 

Great. 

I call back and ask them if they can offer anything else for the inconvenience. She says she'll send a cinnamon pie. (She should have offered, I shouldn't have had to ask) 

10 min later, she calls and says we're out of the delivery area. She says they called seamless when they got the order and cancelled it. 

I called seamless, they said that Papa John's didn't update their delivery radius which is why the order went through and that they didn't call them about the order or there would be notes. 

TL DR They are rude, have terrible customer service, and you'll never get your food.
author: Emma M.

description:
Here's how the millions of dollars in Football advertising works wonders. 
While watching our amazing Forty Niners play the Titans the Papa Johns commercial comes on, and we are craving for pizza. We jumps on the computer and order! 

I cannot remember the last time I have had Papa Johns so expectations are pretty open. There was a special and all I was looking to get was this cool cookie pizza for dessert. We ordered for pick up and since its only 2 miles away- it was smooth and easy transaction!
author: Marie P.

description: This location is awful. The manager there is a total jerk. I had accidentally set my order for carry out but I had wanted it for delivery. I called and asked to switch and the manager told me it would take 2 hours to be delivered only because they were closing in 30 minutes. I called him out on his lie and he claimed that he didn't but was extremely rude and unhelpful. Management should probably not just give away management to anyone, especially someone as rude and disrespectful as this guy. Horrible experience.
author: Bre S.

description: This pizza sucks! I can't believe how people actually like this place! Maybe I'm not giving it much of a chance because I only tried the cheese pizza as a neighbor had an extra one from a buy one get one free offer but nothing impressed me about it. I only like cheese pizzas that are frozen pizzas and I usually buy some kind of cheese pizza to put in the oven or microwave but I never just get a cheese pizza at a pizza place though! There's just too many options and good pizza places out there.
author: David A.

description: This is my second bad review of this particular papa johns. I ordered online at 5:30 and the estimated delivery time was 14-24 and our pizza wasn't delivered until almost 7:30. That's extremely ridiculous. Our delivery man didn't go to the right address and was very rude to me on the phone when I was trying to help him get to the right location. I really like papa johns pizza but this store and the employees that work there are awful. I've had many more negative experiences than positive with this particular store. I don't think I'll be ordering from this store ever again.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: Good value with consistent quality and delivery times. Pretty good fo a national chain.
author: A V.

description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! Especially Myra, who took my order. Not only was she rude over the phone (constantly saying "what else do you want?" "Uh huh" instead of "thank you") but when I picked up my order, she walked up to the register texting, stood there with her phone angled up toward her chest as she reluctantly processed the transaction. Clearly she didn't want to be there and it created a very uninviting experience. The food is decent but because the customer service was extremely rude, I felt this location deserved 1 star.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I'm so upset. I ordered my pizza at 7:48pm and did not receive it till 9:20 taking over an hour. I had to call to check up on my order and turns out the driver didn't  have my contact information for some strange reason so he couldn't call me when he arrived. Had I not called to check up on my order I doubt it would have ever arrived. When he did finally arrive my pizza was cold and unappetizing. It is unacceptable and I will no longer be ordering from Papa Johns.
author: Gerardo G.

description: Came in here earlier today trying to use my groupon deal. For some reason my groupon was acting up and I was about to leave disappointed but then Robert helped me figure things out and made my pizza within 10 minutes.  The rest of the staff was nice too.Great customer service and will definitely be bIack.
author: John U.

description:
Quick, friendly and the pizza isn't bad!

Had the special and it wasn't overly or overbaked. Two tumbs up!
author: Jess W.

description: Every time I order online, it is always late. One time I waited 20 minutes after I was supposed to pick up. They were also not short staffed.
author: Don L.

description:
I love Papa Johns pizza. If you're going to criticize me and call me "retarded" for that, then shove it.

I've been eating Papa Johns since I was a starving student and it's always been a great quick yummy pizza. Sure it's not gourmet like Delfina or Pizzeria Mozza but it's still damn good. Less greasy than Dominos or Pizza Hut.

The downside to Papa Johns in SF is it won't deliver unless you live near the SFSU campus. So being that I signed up to be a rewards member and got the coin toss for the superbowl right (ignore that if you're not aware of the coin toss game they had for the superbowl), I went to claim my free pizza and 2L soda.

The drive to this Papa Johns was hell. There's a roundabout (I hate roundabouts) that you drive around and around waiting to find the exit out to feed you to the mouth of the strip mall but I kept missing it. Maybe I should blame that on myself but it ruined my experience.

All in all a good pizza, just a little far for me.
author: Julia P.

description: I love this place! Their pizza is tasty & the garlic butter is perfection! I've only ordered through eat24 for delivery, and they always seem to take over an hour to deliver (thus my 4 stars). Although, I may always be ordering during peak hours! I did have a very minor issue once, but management was quick to address and resolve. I will continue to order from them when I'm craving delicious pizza!
author: Ilsen M.

description:
Got a followup email from manager of the store that he will honor me back the same Groupon deal. 
Thank you for the kind gesture.  Will be back!
author: Denis Y.

description: I love papa johns! I live close by so i usually pick it up (but on late nights or crazy cold rainy days i get delivery) its my usual go to place for pizza. I have never experienced bad customer service here. Will continue to order from here.
author: Ana C.

description:
Way to use that groupon!  Online ordering makes complex pizzas ez. 
My first time at this location... Our "well done" pizza was barely cooked (I mean why have that option if you never make the pizzas well done?) and I had to ask for the sauce and peppers they forgot to put int he box.

General PJ's makes a decent pie... but we even found a huge artichoke stem in this pizza, um no...
author: Coco J.

description:
Compared to the other pizza chains in the area (Domino's, Round Table, Pizza Hut, etc.), I think Papa John's is the best.  The pizzas are always cheesy and full of flavor.  The garlic sauce is great for the crust, which can be a little dry sometimes.  If you look at the Papa John's website you'll usually find a offer for a large 3 topping for around $12.  If you're looking for a specialty pizza, I recommend "John's Favorite," but that is just my personal preference.

I come to this location probably six times a year and every time so far I have had a pleasant experience.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the pizzas were done in less than 15 minutes.
author: Alan L.

description:
Groupon had a deal going on for $13 you get one extra large pizza with a box of It's-It ice cream.  I missed it the first time but my friend bought it and said it was pretty good. 

So damn skippy I bought it the second time around I saw the Groupon deal since it's a pretty good deal.

Placed an online order for "The Works" at 1:16pm and pizza was ready at 1:57pm.  It was a bit longer than their indicated time of 15-25 minutes though nonetheless I was excited for the It's-It!  MmMMM

Oh, about the pizza... Overall, it's not bad.  It didn't blow me away or anything.  "The Works" had a combination of different meats and veggies.  It's definitely not as greasy as other pizza places.  Their garlic butter sauce is pretty yummy.

Lastly, there was plenty of parking and the manager on duty seem pretty nice.
author: Mabel C.

description: Consistently great customer service!  The woman who answered the phone tonight was very well spoken, professional and thoughtful.  Papa Johns has the phone guest service you would expect from a fine dining restaurant or hotel.  Keep up the great work.
author: Helen F.

description: The guy who takes orders during the evening time (old man wearing glasses and a cap) is rude and unorganized (sorry) .. I saw at least four disappointed customers while waiting for my order ( they did take their sweet own time bringing the pizza) .. And after 45 minutes of waiting, we were served the pizza. -dry-empty-flat-pizza. Hardly any topping on it. The only reason I come here is it's proximity to Park Merced. And this is not the first time that the angry cap man disappointed me. !!
author: Vydesh R.

description: I don't normally write a review, but I decide to give Papa John some credit after seeing so many negative review! I have been ordering from Papa john for a couple of time. I am very satisfied with the service every time: the call get pick up quickly, the order are delivered within the estimate time. Mostly important, the people who answer the phone and the drivers are always friendly and nice!
author: Anita W.

description: Terrible delivery policy. They have a ridiculous policy that they won't go remotely east of 19th Ave. Since I live on 17th, probably a 1 minute detour, I called and asked if they could make an exception. I was alerted that two blocks is ridiculously far and would mess up their whole delivery route. Ok Mr. Manager, A) I feel bad for you if 2 blocks is very far by your standards B) I'm surprised that, as a superior, you were very rude when I wasn't being nasty at all C) I've had another person offer to make an exception for my roommate, so don't say it's impossible to deliver to us. It's also ridiculous because they WILL deliver to 21st Ave, which is, you guessed it, 2 blocks away from 19th, literally the same distance as 17th...Sucks because I actually really like their pizza but they'd rather lose my house's business than drive an extra minute, hmmm.
author: Christina R.

description: Very nice workers and great pizza! They have coupons and discounts that are great and definitely rather pay around $8 for a thick and fresh pizza from papa john than a thin one from costco. Ordering for delivery usually comes quick in about 30-45 min. Pizza is ready for pickup in about 15 minutes if you buy it not during their busy hours.
author: Jessica W.

description: I live @ 355 Serrano. I often order afternoon. Always Kris delivers my pizza - on time. I am very happy with the customer service at Papa John's and the delivery options. Pizza are delusions.
author: Daniela K.

description: Brandon at the Cambon Dr. Location is seriously the coolest guy I've ever met on the phone . He was very compassionate to my specific pizza needs. And I just can't wait to have my Tasty & Delicious BBQ Chicken Pizza!!! Thank you Brandon !!! You rock !!
author: Christine D.

description: Papa John's isn't my favorite pizza place but I took a chance on them anyway. I ordered a square cut bacon & mushroom medium pizza with garlic & half jalapeño as well as their new chocolate brownie. I opened the small box to find they actually sent me a chocolate chip cookie instead of the brownie, which sucked but wasn't a huge deal. I opened the pizza to find it wasn't square cut, but just normal and that also wasn't a huge issue for me...but while I was eating the pizza I nearly broke a tooth on some sort of wooden piece that was hard as a rock and dark brown. Pretty awful experience all around.
author: Simone W.

description:
These guys are just too blazed to care... ordered three different times, lost my order every time.
Weird that they lost my order, they asked me to repeat my order and phone number 13 times... 
What a waste of space, dont bother ordering shitty food from here,  you wont even get it

I tried one more time, and they fucked up again. So I figured something out. Extreme Pizza delivers, and the employees are not trippin balls
http://www.extremepizza.com/
author: Johnny K.

description: Pretty great for what it costs. Fortunately, never had a bad experience with the joint. On one occasion the driver turned up without any chili flakes or seasoning which we thought was very strange/surprising - but its not like its gourmet or anything. Big fan of the thin crust pizzas.
author: R I.

description: Well... Today my friend and I decided to order a pizza from papa johns. We got the bbq chicken pizza expecting great things and what we received was far too saucy. . . And not in a good way.
author: Jeremy D.

description:
WARNING!  these guys are Dorks! they have an asst dork who thinks he's gods gift to papa johns stores. i did an online order & specifically requested the square cut. i get it home & it's the regular cut. i call the store & the asst dork answers & he is rude & a Super Dork providing Rudeness. I carefully explain to him my issue & he plays around with the computer & puts me on hold, i'm guessing he found the problem, so he puts on another guy, obivious the asst dork cannot explain to me in simple english what he can do to appease me. the asst dork actually said to me "I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOUR'E TALKING ABOUT,"  if your'e an asst mgr, isn't it your job to find out?  DORKS!  HE USED AN ENGLISH SPEAKER TO speak to me, What a coward!

CHECK & DOUBLE CHECK YOUR ORDER!
author: david c.

description:
I used to order chicken poppers and cheese pizza from this place. Reason for the low review: 
1. Chicken poppers were sometimes delivered in a box with foiled paper to keep them warm and sometimes were thrown in the box like garbage in trashcan.
2. Only the first time they were crispy, rest of the times it felt like I was being served left overs from other customers plate, all soggy and cold.
3. One star is for the pizza, which tasted good when they had the generosity to give peppers and cheese with it. And yes the pizza happened to be cold too, many a times.
Order from a local pizza place, I bet you will be more satisfied.
author: Aku J.

description: Whoever answers the phone on Wednesday nights really needs to learn better customer service.. that's all I have to say. It shouldn't take more than 5 to complete an order... 15 is a bit too long.
author: Shannaleah S.

description:
Was next door watching the Giants game (on 10/25 @ 7:30pm) and walked by with my friend deciding to get some food from here.  Walked up to the counter and greeted by a blond haired female.  She said..."I'll be right with you."  Stood there for 3 minutes while she was putting in a fax order into the computer.  The phone then rang and she picked up the phone asking "can I help you?"  By this point I was annoyed and told my friend to leave.  We turned around and walked out the front door...she didn't even look up at us...

Wow...great customer service Papa John!!
author: Patrick C.

description:
It may not be exactly Costco cheap, but I love Papa John's pizza. I came into the store for pickup and everyone was busy at work making those delicious pies of dough. There were tons and tons of pizza boxes, towers of them. I was not greeted right away but I was greeted when an employee became free. I had ordered through the website ten minutes before and it was done and ready to go by the time I walked into the store. My main server was very friendly and helped me with my order. I was in and out in less than three minutes tops. 

I got a LG sausage and though the sausage portion was seriously lacking, maybe only 30% of the pie had sausage and even though a little strange, the pizza tastes like a sausage mcmuffin from Mcdonald's! WEIRD, but oddly delicious~ The crust was nice and fluffy?, not really sure how to describe the thick crispiness of the crust. The cheese and tomato sauce is very delicious also. I like how we get a jalapeno pepper and garlic sauce in the pizza box, that is always an added bonus in my opinion.

Customer service is there and the pizza is definitely tasty. B+
author: Alex T.

description:
I bought a groupon for $13 that was good for a large pizza with up to 5 toppings and a 3 pack of it's it ice cream. So while we were out a week ago, I tried to calling the order in with the code and was told that I had to place the order via the internet. After 1/2 hour of trying, I gave up. I'm not ignorant and am computer savvy but their website sucks! 

I decided to use the coupon yesterday and placed the order at home with my laptop. I pulled the address up in mapquest to see where they were located. I called the store and asked how closed to State College they were and was told they were near UCSF, not State College. That was the first indication that morons work here.

Upon arrival, I was handed this little box that had my "large" pizza in it. 5 toppings...really? OMG, I think Domino's has more on their 2 topping pizzas. It wasn't great and I'm sure glad I didn't pay full price for it b/c it sure wasn't even worth $13. If you've not been, don't bother. I won't be back!.

And oh yes, I mentioned to the cashier what I was told on the phone about it being near UCSF and his response was "oh really?" Losers!
author: May G.

description: I was trying to order a  couple pizza's for a party and the rude employee hung up on me before I even ordered!! I called back again trying to order and when I asked him why he hung up he hung up again! I don't know what his deal was, but if he doesn't want to take orders he shouldn't work there.
author: Cindy C.

description:
To be honest and up front.   If you have had Papa Johns you know what to expect.  

If your like me and its late at night and you want a quick bite before bed, avoid this place.  I ordered the personal pizza special for 5.99 and the dude tried to talk me out of it an hour before close.

I worked in the food industry for years and hate late customers but this guy was redic an hour before close.  He charged me for sauce while giving another customer free sauce and did his best to get me out well before 11.

Avoid it if you can but you know how it goes
author: Jon G.

description: friendly professional crew.  the pizza is great and i am a fan of the garlic sauce and pepper on the side.  I got the works and wasn't disappointed.  i like the app, which allows you to customize and then do a carryout.  there is a market in this stripmall that caters to the students nearby, which has a good selection of drinks and snacks.
author: J J.

description: If yelp had a 0 this would deff. get a 0. I'm utterly disgusted! They same guy who was making the pizzas was also at the register. He came over with doughy and floury hands, handled cash when I ordered and paid didn't wash his hands and after touching cash and change went over to make about 3 pizzas handling the dough and toppings. Disgusting! Never went back never will!
author: Evelyn Sophia C.

description:
Better ingredients. Better pizza. Papa John's.

I absolutely love pizza. Sometimes, I lie down and pour tomato sauce all over my body and cover myself with shredded cheese and pretend to be a pizza. THAT'S HOW MUCH I LOVE PIZZA!

Weirdness aside, I've been to all the "gourmet" pizza places in San Francisco (Little Star, Patxi's, Tony's, Pizzeria Delfina, etc.) and continue to come to this simple conclusion: Papa John's has the best pizza in California. I know everyone buckets Papa John's into a quick service restaurant like Pizza Hut and Dominoes, but in reality, Papa John's is a premium brand with much better pizza. In fact, in 1998, Pizza Hut sued Papa John's claiming Papa John's was falsely advertising with its slogan: "Better ingredients. Better pizza. Papa John's." This case made it all the way to the Supreme Court before the Supreme Court realized this case was the stupidest case of all time and clearly Papa John's had better ingredients and better pizza. The appeals court ruled that Papa John's slogan was about personal taste and concluded the cheese from other pizza places was made out of the sour milk from the hairy utters of an ugly anorexic cow. 

Papa John's never freezes any of its ingredients, which is why the pizza tastes so much better than any pizza I've ever had. I view Papa John's as the In-N-Out of pizza. The ingredients are fresher, the food tastes better, and the service is fantastic. Papa John's is a huge company with thousands of locations worldwide so it is able to buy all of its premium ingredients in bulk at a cheaper price than all the expensive and high-end pizza places in San Francisco. Not only are you getting better quality ingredients at Papa John's, but you are also getting it at a much cheaper price. Lastly, I'm excited for the opening of the new Papa John's in the heart of San Francisco that will finally deliver to me; this Cambon location is quite far from the heart of SF.
author: Heisenberg W.

description:
I love Papa John's Pizza.

The Berkeley Papa John's Pizza got me hooked on the stuff. Despite loving the food, I was always disappointed by the wait over at the Berkeley Papa John's Pizza. This being said, I had high hopes for the Daly City Papa Johns's Pizza.

I walked in and ordered a medium pizza. They told me it would take 15 minutes. After waiting 20 minutes I asked to check on the status of my order. Turned out my order had magically disappeared? Their best guess was that one of the delivery guys took it.

After waiting a total of 35 minutes I finally got my pizza. I didn't even get a "Sorry for the wait sir".

I beg you to get your shit together Papa John's.
author: Yoni D.

description:
Pretty legit for normal delivery pizza.  My roommate ordered some for us, which made the price extremely reasonable (free!).  The ordering system online is super simple and takes all the guesswork out of the process.

The delivery time was a bit slow at 30-40 min, but the pizza was hot and tasted good when it arrived.  I really like that this location has roasted garlic that you can put on the pizza, not just wimpy diced garlic.  You'd be surprised how many chain and local pizzerias do not have garlic of any sort to put on your pizza.  You'd think that'd just be a given for a true pizzeria.

The delivery guy was courteous too, so all in all a good Papa John's if you want to order delivery from a chain.
author: Brian L.

description:
the worst pizza and service I have EVER had.

I placed this order  online  at about 5 pm, and it' s now 815--STILL NO PIZZA (read on)  

I placed the order for carry out, and my husband went to go pick it up--when he got home, it was cold, but more importantly,   it was a totally different pizza from my order.

My hubby called the store and they put him through to the manager.  He read off the correct ingredients (chicken, olives, etc) and i stood there and looked at peperoni and green pepper and mushroom--NONE OF WHICH I LIKE ON PIZZA (or anywhere else, for that matter)

The manager said he was willing to give us credit for a free medium.
um...ok, so we buy an extra large, and we get a medium?  Basically, this crap pizza has to go in the trash because it tastes of bell peppers, which I absolutely hate (seriously, I'd rather lick a dog's butt than even smell a bell pepper)

My husband is on his way now for the second time to go pick up the god damned pizza, which he'll have to wait around for, no doubt.

THIS IS THE WORST PLACE when it comes to customer service!!! and the pizza is second rate.

They've lost a customer in me.  Never again.

(if you absolutely have to go to papa johns, the one in san bruno on san mateo ave has never screwed up my order)
author: Lisa B.

description: Usually most papa John's are known for a real quick service. I've been repeatedly offering from this place and been disappointed by the service times. My most recent encounter with them involves waiting at the store for 40 minutes for a personal pizza when there are clearly not as many customers to deal with. I really hope service times are improved here!
author: Vignesh R.

description:
Finally! There's a Papa John's closer to San Francisco. I used to have to drive to San Mateo to get my Papa John's fix. I found out about this location when I was ordering pizza for the Super Bowl and noticed this location as an option for pick up. It's located near the SFSU living complexes. Pizza was bomb, especially with the garlic sauce!!! It didn't hurt that they were having a special: extra large pizza comes with a 3-pack It's It ice cream. But damn, the wait for Super Bowl pizza was an hour (ordered for 3pm when the game started at 3:25pm) even when I ordered it 5 hours prior online. I felt bad for the girl at the counter since everyone was pretty much staring at her while waiting for their orders.

Next year for Super Bowl, order for 2pm so the pizzas will be ready at 3pm.
author: Tina T.

description:
The good: pizza is not greasy. I've had pizza from many places and the pizza here definitely is not as greasy/oily as others. Customer service is ok.

The bad: toppings! Or should I say, what toppings? I've ordered from here numerous times and just about every time I get my pizza, it seems like the toppings are missing. I'm sure it's there... Somewhere... I ordered a 7 topping pizza and when I received my pizza, it looked liked a cheese pizza! If I'm paying for 7 toppings, I expect to see AT LEAST more than 1 topping! 

Not sure if I'll come back!
author: Elle N.

description: Pissed off. I placed an order online & they didn't give me an option to pick a flavor for ice cream (its it). I called right away & the customer service rep said he'd change the order. The delivery guy came my order wasn't changed. CUSTOMER SERVICE PEOPLE!!! It's fast food. Don't mess up a delivery!!!!! Never gonna order here again. Pizza is okay but there are better franchises  in The City.
author: Mimi B.

description:
I got a groupon for Papa Johns last couple days and thought I would try it out. After numerous tries on the PJ website I couldnt get it to work so I called the store and they said "sure, print out the groupon and we will honor it in-store". 
THIS MADE MY DAY. 
I love the pizza and of course also the flexibility with my web ability! 
Thanks Papa Johns!
author: Leo S.

description: Open on holidays! Great pizza! Received my pizza earlier that what's expected! Awesome pizza! The official pizza sponsor of the NFL! The girl on the phone didn't give me a hard time on the phone, (unlike Pizza Hut employee). 49ers need to beat the Seahawks
author: Mahmoud A.

description: if there was a way to give these folks zero stars I would.  They screwed up an online order and wouldn't make it right. They blamed me. is it worth while to piss off a really good customer over their mistake.
author: Terrence G.

description: Ordered a large pizza delivery here once.  DId it online and got the confirmation that it would take 35 to 43 minutes.  So we wait....an hour later, still nothing.  I called the place and they said they sent the wrong email and that it was actually an hour to hour and ten minutes for the pizza to come, and that it would be 'hot and fresh'. Twenty minutes later it comes, and it's slightly cold.  Can't believe they charge these ridiculous prices for crappy pizza that comes cold and late.
author: Tommy Q.

description:
Worst customer service. I called in to make an order and the man said it'll be ready in 25m. I get there a little before 25m and there was an elder man in front if me. This guy at the counter greeted us and said someone will be right with us. He continues folding boxes and placing stickers on these boxes. Wow seriously?? He couldn't help us first then continue with the boxes later? After about 10m of us standing around, someone else comes to help us.  

-_- they need to rearrange their priorities
author: Serena F.

description:
Not bad for a chain pizza joint, but there are far better options in San Francisco to ever have to resort ordering from here.

Honestly I would have given 3 stars but i deducted one because the delivery fee was $3.29
author: Alex L.

description:
I literally only come here to talk to and look at the hottie that works the cash register. I could swim laps in her deep brown eyes all day. Every time I go, I try to work up the nerve to ask her to write her phone number on my pizza box. 

I just wish that they had name tags so I could learn her name. 

Besides that, the pizza they make is AWESOME and their Groupon deal is amazing. My favorite is "The Works" - its a mix of everything i like on a pizza!

Great place! Just needs more seating and wifi and I could spend all my time in there!
author: Bill S.

description: I usually order delivery when I'm lazy to cook. Three months ago, I bought three of their $13 groupon deals that worth for one large five-topping pizza and a box of It's it ice cream, pretty cool deal, and they lasted me for a month. My fav so far is the big bonanza :))
author: Yanakon D.

description:
I loved the pizza za and the service it was amazing I will defiantly come back and will recommend any one to go there.
Got to have at least 2 slices of pizza here if you go
author: Dave D.

description:
Oh papa... why must you be so unkind? To my thunder-thighs that is! I didn't get these juicy badboys from my many "taking back the night" rallies... ladies. I got 'em from calling up my sugar papa and getting a large hot pizza baked hotter than a wi-fi hotspot, and laid precariously over my glistening flesh like that scene from American Graffiti. 

They could be a little more generous with the toppings, but for this price, I should be paying THEM... wait a minute.
author: Josh K.

description: First, it arrive 25 minutes later than I was told. so of course it is barely warm. second I ordered the "It's It" ice cream and I hadn't had one for years. Well when they asked what kind I wanted I said vanilla. I ended up with mint.  It was just not a great experience for a 12 inch peperoni Pizza and two its its (They sent 3) for 29 bucks including tip. Sorry Peyton not your month.
author: Steve B.

description:
I like pizza and I like cheap and while I'm not exactly a "starving" student, cheap, fast pizza does the job for me.

I like Papa John's because they offer artichoke hearts, sundried tomatoes and roasted garlic as exotic toppings (good luck finding that @ Pizza Hut!).  Knowing my expectations I have ordered several pizzas from them online with Groupons or coupons they send in the mail.  There is a 10% discount if you order online too.

I've never had any problems with their customer service.  They have always been polite, fast and helpful on the phone and I have always got my pizza in less than the quoted time (granted I have almost always taken it to go).

The one time I had it delivered it took much longer than the quoted time.  Called the store and they said it had already been delivered right as I saw the delivery guy veer around the corner.  He looked new and anxious so I quickly forgave the late effort.  I always pick up now and the pie takes less than 10-15 mins every time.

I like how they can be a bit sloppy with their toppings and how everything sort of falls off the slice as I eat it (my fault, I always order extra sauce!).  But for $11.79 Large five topping pizza, I can't really complain.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I've always found it strange that there is no good local delivery pizza in the sunset. 

Papa johns is however, very good, and as it turns out, locally owned. 

I know, I know, national chain, how could it be 5 stars? Well, every time I order I get exactly what they promise, delivered hot, by a very friendly driver. 

The one time I didn't get exactly what I expected, I took the time to send them an email through their national website, within an hour the local owner of the shop personally called me to apologize. That is customer service, that is what gets you 5 stars, that is the reason I'll order from them again.
author: Derek d.

description:
I'm still a little bit new to the Bay Area itself but when it comes to pizza, I know that very well. I have nothing bad to say about the pizza. It taste just as good as it did last time. However, the customer service that I witnessed was unbelievable. 
To see someone step away from stretching dough and to greet a customer, make sure she was happy, and offer her help with her carry out is above and beyond. 
I was really stoked on the friendly environment how how everyone felt welcomed to engage in conversation even with the cook. 
James has the best customer service, and Maria, I really tasted the love you put in my pizza. I must say, You two made my visit Ideal. So ideal, I'm writing my first Yelp review to tell the world! Thank You!
author: General K.

description:
First experience with Papa John's. I got a postcard in the mail for an $11 pizza special. Called to order it. Poor service on the phone; distracted, unfriendly. Bad first impression. 

Then he tells me there's a $3.50 delivery charge. In the same neighborhood! An absolute racquet. That is an absurd delivery charge. Got it anyway, because it was late, and overall it was still about $16 for dinner. Once I heard there was a $3.50 delivery charge, I knew I'd never be ordering from them again. 

On the plus side, they arrived quickly and the pizza was good. I tipped, because I know it's not the delivery driver's fault, but delivery fee plus tip makes the $11 "deal" seem like a total farce. Not into it.

There's too much competition, just as good, minus the bs.
author: Adam R.

description: We always have great service at this Papa John's. We ordered pizza here tonight and they called to let us know it was ready. Rachel was the one that took my order and waited on me when I picked up. She was so friendly and efficent! A great go to pizza!
author: Abbey F.

description: Literally the worst papa johns I have ever experienced. I ordered a pizza and found a lonnnnnng BLACK hair, called them, and a lady with a heavy accent was literally arguing with me for 10 minutes about how she couldn't give me a refund and said I needed to "save" the hair ?! WHAT THE DAMN HELL?! do NOT ORDER FROM HERE
author: Gabriella R.

description: They always get my order wrong.  Like always.  But they do deliver to my house so that's worth a star...I just wish it was what I actually ordered.  Last time I ordered the delivery girl brought me only the order of cheese sticks and I'm like "this receipt is for 37 dollars" and she said "yea I thought that was weird" lol.  She went back and got the actual pizza but I was offered no discount by the manager or anything....that's just my latest experience I have plenty others too
author: Josh M.

description:
WOW!!! Whats the deal. I ordered my pizza today 11/11/2012 at around 3:30pm. Its 5 minutes away from being 8:30pm. I called three times asking where my pizza at. I wouldve called more times however I was into the football games on. I've watched 3 football games and still haven't got my pizza. Even til now that I am writing this review and watching sportscenter, my pizza is not here. It sucks that the pizza is pretty good but what the workers doing over there that they can't deliver my pizza. 
 Each time I called I spoke very politely and understanding that yea there is alot of orders going out because of football. However, 5 hours to wait for a pizza? What kind of staff do they have working there. 
Funny how I asked for delivery and on the last call the lady working the phones said it was carryout, HAHAHAHAHA I asked for delivery, Had I asked for carryout I would've picked up my pizza hours ago. I feel like they were trying to blame me for having my pizza being late. 
Check it its 8:40pm and I'm almost done writing this extremely bad review and I still haven't got my pizza. 
I think I'm going to be on the Guiness World Record of Beyond Late Pizza delivery times. Soon to be 5 and a half hours. 
To the Owner of the PAPA JOHNS PIZZA near SF State, you need to audit and re-evaluate your staff. 
I'm very sorry but you've lost a customer. Needless to say you could lose more with the staff you have. You need to run your business better. 
Good Luck in the Future
and by the way...
It's almost 9 pm, WHERE'S MY PIZZA?
author: Anthony P.

description:
I had a problem with the customer service in a previous visit, but the owner wrote me a message to apologize and gave me a free pizza! Thanks!
The customer service this time was way better; I called to change my order a couple of hours before I was supposed to pick it up, and they were understanding and polite. I had no problems picking up the order, it was in and out, very fast service.
They have very good deals, especially if you order online. I will definitely come back for the deals.
author: Sam T.

description: The guy never wash hand! Cook, make order, make phone call, get cash! Touch everything! Disgusting! By seeing this, I will never go to there again!
author: Roger W.

description: What the hell do you mean you can't do half BBQ chicken half John's favorite?
author: Alex G.

description: I still enjoy Papa John's pizza.. just made the mistake of ordering thin crust to try the other night and it was gross and tasted like it was frozen and microwaved. Definitely sticking to regular next time. At least this past pizza was free, thanks to the coin toss from the super bowl. Also, they messed my order up.. I clicked on square cut under the instructions online. I don't know how they missed it (didn't seem like they were that busy).. but like I've said in my first review.. they seem to make boo boo's quite frequently. I checked (as advised) my pizza before I left the place and it was wrong.. and looked like a sad pizza. The girl working at the front, Michaela (sorry if I misspelled your name) offered for them to fix it, but I was in a rush to get home, so I declined, so she took it upon herself to fix the pizza makers mistake and offer me a small box of it's it's on the house. Definitely good customer service and Michaela is definitely a keeper in your establishment. Thanks girl. Next time I won't order thin crust, that's for sure!
author: Tiff C.

description:
My former roommate creamed his pants over Papa John's, and he didn't usually cream his pants over anything involving chain restaurants. He use to work at a Papa John's place when he use to go to school in Arizona (or did he work in SoCal? Could have been both, I forgot) He would talk for years about wishing there was a Papa John's in the City. I don't know what Pagan god he was worshiping to get it, but it came to him, and it was super close.

It's not like I didn't believe him about the awesomeness of Papa John's, but this was the same person who said SoCal burritos are better than the burritos made in San Francisco. And he said dogs can't look up... no wait, that was from Shaun of the Dead... my bad.

We ordered online, and I was amazed that a pizza joint had a very competent online order system that wasn't Pizza Hut (meh.) The delivery guy was on time and cool, and the pizza was great. It wasn't as great as Escape from New York's You Say Potato pizza, and I have to have a taste test with this and Senore's... but for its price, this pizza was really, REALLY good. The garlic Parmesan breadsticks are freakin' awesome, but I think it's glazed with some type of human catnip or liquid crack. And sure, their cheesesticks are basically a cheese pizza cut in rectangular slices, but it's still good.

I've read the other reviews, but honestly for me, I've never had a problem with them. The pizza was usually good to great, and they always have a good deal going on. Plus, it felt like seven times out of ten, I'd get a free box of It's Its, which makes it even more awesome.

Since I've moved, I've only ordered once from them, and when I ordered online, it wouldn't allow me to pick "delivery," and when I thought I fixed it, it still said "pick up." I called them up and they said my location was literally on the border of their delivery limit, that the other side of my street was their cut off, but they made an exception and fixed the problem with no complaints. 

I'm giving them a very high 4 stars. They're not perfect, and I've had better pizza, but I definitely prefer them over any other national chain like Pizza Hut and Domino's (Round Table is second.) I would totally suggest ordering from here again (though I'll have to call instead of order online if I'm home.)
author: Chris S.

description: This place is normally out of my budget range, but on Tuesdays they have a really good 2 for 1 deal.  Only 15 bucks for 2 large1 topping pizzas! The pizza itself isnt bad at all, and the service is average. The portions are good though. I definately reccomend this for anyone on Tuesdays, otherwise, I'd pass.
author: Sam A.

description: I'm so disappointed with their service especially phone call reaction.. They behaved so rude and Gave me some uncomfortable feeling.. Finally, I couldn't ordered during 1:30hour because of miscommunication. I didn't know how difficult to "ORDER" via online and phone.
author: Bum P.

description:
So quick and tasty
My scale stops at 300
Well, see no evil...
author: Jesse S.

description:
So the pizza here is ok. I'm Italian and I'm a hard one to win over on this one. I'm never expecting amazing authentic fabulous delicious pizza, especially not from a chain delivery place right next to a college. What I do expect is my order, delivered on time, correct toppings and freshness.  

What I have consistently gotten from this location is the wrong toppings, forgotten items, and a lack of concern about that. Also, why does it take 45 minutes for you to deliver my pizza when I live 5 blocks away? That's right, I live inside Park Merced. 45 minutes? Did he walk, the long way round? 

The employees never know what the specials are (or don't feel like sharing the info) and consistently tell me that they cannot honor sales or deals from the NATIONAL website because "we are special, we offer free ice cream here instead of those deals, nobody else does that". Okay. Who the eff wants It's It with pizza? Who thought up that brilliant scheme?? Ice cream sandwiches and pizza aren't exactly peas and carrots my friends. Also, if you don't want to honor national deals from your corporate website, maybe you shouldn't have purchased a franchise...?

The fifth time they screwed up my order I emailed the corporate office. I didn't hear back from them for a few weeks so I sent another email asking if their customer service office is a black hole in the abyss, and was called back by the store manager a few days later. He said he had called repeatedly and left messages (sure, ok, I guess my digital voicemail is on the fritz again??) and has a free pizza waiting for me at the store when I want it. He mentioned that he never gets complaints about this store and was "highly surprised" by my email. Apparently he doesn't check this yelp page very often... I'll re-review this location once I get my free pizza...
author: MrsKimch I.

description:
I got a coupon flier in the mail for Papa John's Pizza. It worked out to something like $25 for two extra-large specialty pizzas to be delivered with two free boxes of It's-Its. I normally pay at least that much for just one extra-large pizza at my local spots.
I was really curious how much worse this absurdly cheap pizza could be.
Well... it was okay I guess. One star for the quick delivery, another for the Chuckie Cheese grade pizza, and another for the absurd cheapness. Maybe if the recession continues I'll find myself calling them again...
author: Claire C.

description:
I have a friend who talks a lot about Papa John's from his college days in Hicksville, IN (sorry, make that West Lafayette, IN. Yes, he's a Purdue grad). This year we decided to get together for the Superbowl. So I decided to treat him to a Papa John's pizza.

"Really? Are you really going to get me a Papa John's??? I love you man!!", followed by a manly fist-bump (no hugging or other such displays of affection for us insecure str8 guys) was his reaction.

Now, I know pizza places can get busy on SB Sunday. But I'm thinking: this is Papa John's. They're a chain. They know the drill by now. Still, to give them enough of a lead time, I ordered the pizza online around noon, for pickup at 2:45. I'm thinking: pick it up at 2:45, zip back on Portola, stick it into the oven and zippidy-doo-dah, I'm all set. Game starts at 3.

I show up at 2:45 after bumbling around in the maze down by SFSU, and there's a long line. Secretly congratulating myself over my awesome move to order online, I find myself pitying the folks standing in line. 

With a straight face I casually tell the dweebs in line: "I just have to pick up my pizza. I ordered it online for pickup at 2:45". I'm looking forward to the Moses moment, as the crowd parts for my approach to the pickup counter.

"Me too", says one. And another. And another. 
"I was supposed to pick mine up at 1:30, and I'm still waiting".

Whaaat?? How is this possible?

As I stood there, torn between getting to the game, and keeping the promise to my buddy, I watched the sorry state of affairs in this pizza place. They had no clue about what they were doing. The girl at the checkout counter was completely overwhelmed. Every few minutes she'd say "your pizza will be ready in just a minute", followed by more bumbling around. I heard irate customers (who had ordered delivery, apparently) call to complain and be put on hold; followed by the eventual disconnection. A lady walked in and was told that pizza would take an hour; but chicken fingers would be done right away. So she ordered the chicken fingers. And waited 45 minutes for them too anyways. 

Eventually, I got my pizza at 3:45, and missed the entire first quarter (which wasn't that great, from what I heard). 

The pizza was just plain average. The wait and lack of preparedness just did it for me; never again I'm going back.

Oh, and they did give me a free box of "It's It" Icecream, for the trouble.
author: A J.

description:
LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION: A+

I once ordered food to be delivered to my mans place in Lake Merced. They were able to take my order as soon as I called, even though it was Saturday night. No "please hold" just quick and easy service. 

The staffer who answered was friendly & assured me my delivery would take no more than a half hour  to arrive. They even got my cell phone just in case... which they did end up having to use (whooopsies).

In less than an hour Vanilla & Mint flavored Ice-Cream Sandwiches were delivered to a smiling happy face. 

Thank You Papa!! Another job well done.
author: Diana D.

description: I ordered pizza online. I get my confirmation and when I go to pick up they tell me you didn't place an order. I bring in my phone to show them the confirmation. These jackasses then tell me I have to wait 30min!!!!! I say well since your company fucked up, do I get my pizza for free? They respond no! Not like they give a fuck about losing my business, but this place sucks!!
author: Customer P.

description: These guys are super chill and make good pizza quick and easy. There is one old fat guy that is a real jackass who really needs the boot, because other than him the store is really on point. I like that they serve its-it and it brings a sense of community to the table which is rather desirable.
author: Christopher M.

description:
Once in awhile, Papa John's will have special promos on sites like Groupon and LivingSocial to offer their Specialty Pizzas and a three-pack box of It's-It Ice Cream Sandwiches (available in vanilla, cappuccino, or mint flavor) at a discount. Although their pizzas are good and try to be gourmet, they fall short in a few areas: quality of the pepperoni and sausages is questionable and can't compete with pizzerias; tomato sauces that can be too sweet and uninspiring (unoriginal, bland, flat) in flavor; cheeses that don't melt; and the pizza needs to stay in the oven longer to allow the dough to bake thoroughly. Also, there's a reason why toppings are called...."toppings". I do not understand why they bury most of ingredients under the cheese.

1.  Hawaiian BBQ Chicken (5/5) -- The tangy sweet barbecue sauce worked great with all of the toppings, from the wholesome white chicken pieces, crumbles of bacon, mild but sweet red onions to the juicy pineapples. And the pizza wasn't too greasy or oily too!

2.  Spicy Italian (5/5) -- This pizza could use more heat! They delivered the spicy Italian kick by way of generous portions of small spicy Italian sausages but they should have thrown in spicy pepperoni as well! Overall, a more interesting choice than a meat lover's typical salty all-meats-topping pizza.

3.  The Meats (4.5/5) -- Saltiness is the name of the game! What do you expect when pepperoni, (regular, non-spicy) sausage, beef, hickory smoked bacon and Canadian bacon are loaded on the pizza? Honestly, though, all the meats tasted the same when buried underneath the mozzarella cheese, and I can't remember if tasted any beef.

4.  The Works (4/5) -- It's topped with the usual pepperoni, Italian sausage, green bell peppers, red onions, mushrooms and olives; the only oddball it also includes is the Canadian bacon.

5.  Garlic Chicken (3/5) -- Because the tangy sourness of the the garlic ranch sauce overwhelmed the toppings, this pizza did not rate well for me, even more so that it lacked strong garlic flavor. The white chicken meat was not grilled. I appreciate they used whole garlic cloves but not all pieces were well roasted. The artichokes, buried under cheese and needed to be roasted, were saltier than the the ranch sauce.
author: Cliff W.

description: I been a Papa John's Fan since 1998. This branch pretty much matches the standard of quality of every other place I have been; however, there is one thing that stands out to me, which is the great customer service I receive from James every time I went there. That is why I gave this place a 5 star for service. Food and Price wise I would only give it a 4 Star. Just a note for everyone who does order from there, order it online and look for coupon codes. It will save you $$ in the long run.
author: Mike K.

description:
A friend recommended Brenda's shop to me so I booked an appointment. When I arrived I was immediately shouted at by the receptionist who told me I was 10 minutes late!?!

Brenda was a bit scary and wouldn't stop talking - for every wig she showed me she tried on at least 4 herself! Before I knew it I'd been in there 2 hours and knew everyone's life story - and they knew mine!!! Everyone was so friendly though and I'll definitely be going back when I need a new look for my birthday next month!!!
author: Chris P.

description:
If you are a pizza fan like me do not order this.  If you need to feed the family you can depend on these guys.

We order from them once or twice a month.  They screwed up one order but made it right with no problems.

I did have an issue while talking to someone who said that they were the district manager.  He is an ass.  'nuff said.
author: J K.

description:
Now that I live near one, have to say when we have ordered there pizza its been great! fresh cut everything was a bit surprised how good the pizza is and if you get an extra large you get free Its It ice cream! SCORE!!

ok and its like 100 feet away from us helps too :)
author: Mark M.

description:
My family had some Papa John's pizza at a BBQ a while back and thought it was decent.  I found out there was a Papa John's by school so I put orders in online so I can pick it up on my way home.  This location is hidden away in a very small plaza mall. Everytime I come here to pick up pizza, it's always hassle free and a quick in and out.  
The first time I ordered a pizza from here, there was a good amount of toppings.  Then the second, third, and fouth time I ordered from here, the toppings were undetectable.  We usually order veggie toppings and I'm always disappointed whenever we do.  We ordered a pizza with tomatoes, mushrooms, and artichokes.  My first slice of pizza had only half a slice of a tomato, no mushrooms, and no artichokes.  The other slices wasn't much than that. Wtf... if I ordered and paid for a 3 topping pizza, I should have three different toppings on each slice of pizza!
I guess expect a cheese pizza with very sparse toppings.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: Bought a chicken Bacon Ranch Original pizza, the pizza itself was just ok. Price was great, that's why the 1 star rating, paid $13.05 with taxes for the medium size pizza. Couple of hours later my wife and myself had a case of diarrhea. Thanks Papa John for the better ingredients, will not buy again.
author: Zhenya B.

description: My first Papa John's Pizza order was more than decent, yet I didn't order a lot. Mainly went to try out their signature pizza menu. Loved it. The only thing about this Papa John's Pizza that kind of irritated me, was the location. Hard to find, but really close to SF State. Subscribe to their emails and you'll get updated coupons at Papa John's Pizza and even save more with earning up points when you buy pizzas. You can subscribe to their emails and earn points all by ordering online and setting up your own pizza account. Overall this Papa John's Pizzeria gets 4 stars. Oh yeassssirrreeee!  :)
author: John P.

description:
chicken bacon ranch, buffalo wings and it's it Ice Cream. Can't complain. 

whatever, it's a chain. I can get over it (I'm not some whitebread hipster from the suburbs who claims to be some foodie because he eats baobob and wears tom's).

but they haven't gotten me sick like some places in the city (I'm looking at you Georgio's Pizza).
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: Papa Johns is fast to deliver, but many times they did not put enough toppings on the pizza and everything was falling off. It was not the best pizza, but it is cheap and if you order online you get points for a free pizza!
author: Makana Y.

description: Wow. How disappointing. I was expecting better. Not even as good as Costco Pizza. I ordered a medium with mushrooms & sausage. Mostly just cheese and sweet tomato sauce. I would say its on the level of bad cafeteria pizza. I recommend going to Paradise Pizza on West Portal or Sophia's Pizza on Ocean.
author: Art G.

description: Let me start by saying I'm basing this review off of 2 or 3 out of idk how many orders I've made. Something I've learned out of those orders are simple pizza from here often results in better pizza. I would say my best orders would be a pepperoni cheese, or this one pizza I order that has chicken, onion, 3 cheese blend, and mushrooms. The pizza doesnt come out tasting soggy or too much, like my other experiences. The garlic butter is a must and goes well with the crust (if you're getting an XL, add another garlic butter to your order because there won't be enough to go around!). I always order the regular marinara sauce just because my experience with the garlic ranch sauce was always overwhelming. I also avoid more liquidy ingredients like tomatoes because the texture almost always ends up weird and makes everything taste soggy. They deliver in less than 30 minutes if you live at park merced, upn/ups, etc despite ETA so be sure to keep your pants on!
author: Nikki R.

description: This place is gross.  I just moved here and thought it was a reliable choice.  The service is horrible.  They made me stand outside to order my pizza on-line to get the special.  On Tuesdays they have buy one get on free and always charge me for both unless I argue the advertising.  I will never return, even though it's two blocks away.
author: Kristi L.

description: It's good food, but service is a little shady. I got a text the next day saying "this is Papa Johns" the next day after I ordered delivery. I thought it was a little weird. Other than that, it's local and the it's it ice cream is amazing! Ice cream and pizza! Sounds like a party
author: Simi J.

description:
After waiting forever to have some Papa John's since who knows when, my coworker ordered one for delivery with an order of cheese bread.

damn i know it came in 30 minutes and all but it was well worth it and the pizza came hot.

one large order of bbq chicken pizza loaded with chicken, ffrehs onions, green onions, and super good crust.

the cheesey bread was perfectt and i have no complaints about their service - the delivery guy was real nice.

over all, i cant wait to get pizza from here again (when im craving some that is) and damn imagine SUPERBOWL SUNDAY THAT PLACE IS GONNA BE BUSY! oh and the garlic sauce was perfect melted garlic buttery goodness, gotta wathc out for that stuff man
author: Kenny L.

description:
First time ordering from here.  After a while, the commercials convinced me.

Phone order- they kept putting me on hold (3x) for long periods of time. When they'd come back on, we'd have to start over again.  We ordered 5 large, thin- crust specialty pizzas.
  
Delivery- they said it would take 35 min.  Pizzas came after an hour- luke warm.  I asked the delivery guy about the garlic dipping sauce I heard about that came with the pizzas. Delivery guy said the sauces are in each box.  Mind you, there were 5 large pizzas.  When I opened them, there were none. I called papa john's and told them about it. The staff said it didn't come with it. Hmmmm. So what is it? 

Pizza- VERY SKIMPY on the ingredients. Not worth it.  

First time and last time. I don't recommend them.
author: M D.

description: We order from Papa John's pretty regularly.  They have a lot of onlline specials.  They give you a choice of thick or thin crust, light or extra sauce, regular or light cheese...and they have lots of 2 pizza specials.  My bf and I are big eaters and we usually order our own pizzas.  He always gets the thin crust which is always very crispy almost like a cracker..but he gets extra sauce which balances it out. I always get jalapenos on my pizza they are always crunchy and spicy but not too hot. The are a few things I do not like about this place is they charge you a delivery fee, maybe it's to make up for people who don't tip well....and they ALWAYS skimp on the mushrooms!! For the most part though they make good pizza and the delivery man is always very personable and friendly...he even greets our dogs nicely.
author: Charla M.

description:
I bought a Groupon for an X-large pizza up to 7 toppings and 3 it's it ice cream for $13! What a deal! You must place your order on-line to use the Groupon. Website is easy to use. Placed my order and received an email right away stating my order will be ready in 15-20 minutes. This was my first visit to Papa John's. Plenty of parking. My order was ready when I arrived. The staff is awesome and they rock! This location is located right by SFSU...so the place is always busy with college students.  We ordered an X-Large pizza with one half sausage, mushroom, black olives and fresh tomatoes and the other half ham and pineapple (our usual pizza order for any pizza joint). It was yummy. There's something different about the dough that makes it oh soo good compared to other places. We also ordered cheese sticks. It was insanely good.
