If I wasn't watching my calorie intake to fit in my wedding dress I would have eaten the whole thing. I'm soo glad that there was a Groupon for this joint because if it didn't I wouldn't have known about this place. Papa John's is definitely going on our list of pizza joints! 

MMMM...Cheese sticks!!! *drool*
author: Jo S.

description:
I had a slight problem with the toppings on a pizza and called in to just let them know.  The manager gave me a free pizza voucher, and I was able to redeem it when I called in a few weeks later.  I love this place! 

Remember to use the online system to make sure you can earn free pizza!

Thank you Papa John's Pizza!
author: Rob M.

description: Working on NYD is not a fun gig, and I wanted to show my team some love.  So I ordered from the closet Papa John's to...you know.....just say thanks.  Not only was their staff SUPER friendly and on time, they gave me an awesome deal.  I won't order from another delivery pizza restaurant EVER!  Thanks guys.  What a great start to a New Year.
author: Oyinda M.

description:
I think its illegal to call the food here PIZZA.  Worst pizza I have ever eaten in my life!  You are better off getting a frozen pizza (ANY BRAND) and it will be 10x better than this.  

The positive reviews here must not know what real pizza should taste like
author: Dan M.

description:
big parking lot in front..just have to have the correct timing but some will open up.

for fast pizza.  this is a very very good pizza.  much better than the other two cheaper chains.

the one thing i wish was that they had more toppings to choose from.  like canadian bacon instead of ham.  also, regular mushrooms instead of portabello mushrooms.

give it a try if you want some cheap decent pizza.
author: Bing D.

description: Friendly... fast service...great pizza! love the thin crust..love it!
author: Nissan Z.

description: Today I ordered a pizza from them, the dough was flat and under cooked, and there are only few piece of meats laying on top.
author: Sapphire L.

description: Take for $8 with the right promo code isn't so bad. Also the Peppercini and garlic sauce is cool.  I have had this at  parties and its not the worst nor the greatest. I usually end up eating the peppercini as I'm 1/4 Sicilian/Spaniard and others don't have that need to do so. Its their trademark. Also the garlic sauce is basically melted margarine with salt and garlic.
author: R C.

description:
the pizza tastes good, i won't deny that.

so i called in an order for a medium pizza, with 2 toppings on it, and it came in to a little more than $14.  the girl on the phone offered me cheese sticks, which i denied, and offered to make the pizza 30% bigger for only $2, which i also denied.

i get there to pick it up, and i see a sign for this deal that they have: an extra large pizza, with up to 4 toppings, plus 4 it's it ice cream bars.. for $11.99.  for $2 less than what i paid for a smaller pizza with no ice cream.  

so i said to the girl, "are you the one that took my order on the phone?" and she said, "yes." and i asked her why she didn't tell me about this deal, which would have been way more pizza plus ice cream, for less money than what i was paying for a smaller pizza.  she said, because you called on the phone.  then, she had the nerve to say, "and now you know about this deal for next time!"

now, i don't get mad easily.  especially at service people, because i've spent so many years of my life working in restaurants and bars.  granted, maybe there is some kind of store policy against telling phone orders about what kind of deals you can get in store.  and she probably wasn't the owner/manager of this location, just some college kid working at a pizza place on the side.  i get it. i really, really, really do.

but she obviously didn't get me, and what my point was.  which, was simply, that i was paying more money for a smaller pizza, and that if she had told me about the deal on the phone, i would have went with that.  but no, she offered to make my pizza bigger for $2, which STILL would have been smaller than an extra large, and about $4 more expensive than just ordering the deal.  

i don't know.  maybe it's petty to be arguing over a couple of dollars (note: i wasn't actually arguing with the girl, i asked her a couple of polite questions and ended up just walking out after saying thank you).  but to me, it's the principle of the situation-i wasn't asking for a refund, or something extra, and i wasn't complaining, i was simply asking her why she didn't tell me about the deal over the phone.  which she didn't really respond to, except to tell me that now i knew about it for "next time."

however...the pizza was freaking tasty.  grrrrr.  the garlic sauce they give you is sinfully delicious.
author: asia c.

description:
Papa John's pizza is awesome! I love their signature garlic sauce that they always include with their pizzas. I always order my pizzas online and they post all their current deals on their website plus they give you 10% off. You can't get better than that. You get what you pay for and Papa John's definitely have better pizza than other chains like Pizza Hut, Dominos, and Round Table. I recommend everyone to order their pizzas online to take advantage of the current deals they got online. I just ordered a large with 5 toppings online for $10.79 ($11.99 + 10% discount). Just finished eating half the pizza by myself because it tastes that delicious. 

Don't call Papa John's and expect them to tell each and every customer about their current deals. If you want to save money, then do your homework.
author: unknown u.

description: This is mediocre pizza.  The veggies are not fresh or good, despite their motto about  using "better ingredients".    There are so many better places to get pizza in SF, I should have known better.  Instead I got a stomach ache!  I would not recommend!
author: Jessica B.

description: Of the pizza chains, Papa John's is my favorite.  You can order your pizza online and have it customized to your liking.  The toppings taste fresh and I like the crust and pizza more than any of the other chains.  Also, I heard that you get a free 3 pack of It's It ice cream with any purchase of an extra large pie.  Oh, and their signature garlic sauce is heavenly!
author: Tyler C.

description: So I've had Papa John's Pizza before and loved it. I was happy to see they opened one not too far from me. I ordered 2 Large Pizzas for delivery on a Sunday for an NFL Football playoff get together. Our pizza arrived fast and piping hot. Unfortunatily that's the only compliment we can give. When we dug in expecting a great pizza, all the toppings fell to the ground. Ok so the pizza might have been a little soft but when we looked closer, the dough was still raw. We tried to eat it but it but the raw dough was just too disgusting. From what we ate, the toppings and sauce tasted decent but the dough just ruined it. Anyhow, we couldn't finish the pizza and ended up throwing it away. What a waste. We ended up ordering 2 more pizza's from another place. Bummer.......I understand they are a new location but I hopw they work on the quality.
author: Eddie N.

description: Awesome prices, the staff is always on it!  How can you beat a large pizza for under $10?  You can't.  With this place so close to my house, it's unfortunately a weekly ritual.  Oh, and the crust!  So good!
author: Alex K.

description: 1st I like their pizza... 2nd this store is totally ridiculous. We live exactly 1.54 miles away from the store. AND THEY WONT DELIVER TO US!!!! Where the heck do you deliver? The website said they wouldnt... I figured this must be a mistake.  So I called. The gentleman on the phone said hold on while he asked. He picked back up and said "they aren't going for it man" whatever that means... Its 1.54 miles away!! Meanwhile the D**%$ in the back is yelling "so sorry good bye"... I love PJs pizza this store sucks...
author: Blake H.

description: I have to agree with the recent reviews.  the pizza good, but the customer service is the best.
author: jim l.

description: I really like how close this Papa John's is to my apartment.  It is literally across the street.  Also, with all of the coupons available, you get so much food, and it is better quality than Pizza Hut and Domino's.  I don't have to tip anyone to deliver the pizza either, since I can just walk across the street to get it.  We got a Tuscan Garden pizza, pineapple pizza, and parmesan cheese pizza.  They were soooo delicious, with delicious sauce, and cooked perfectly!  If you live or are super close to this location, and are hungry for pizza, I recommend this place.  Also, the guys inside are really cool and nice and actually seem like they enjoy working there.
author: Candiace A.

description: The customer service at this place is terrible! If I could give it 0 starts I would. I ordered in the store and for some reason it took a while for them to enter in my card. Once the transaction was finally done he said it would take 10 minutes, so I decided to sit and wait inside. I ended up waiting for 30 minutes for a personal pepperoni pizza! During my time waiting I noticed that the workers don't change their gloves when they switch from making pizza to taking orders at the register. Gross. I even saw someone order after me, and they got their order done before mine! So after 30 minutes I asked how much longer it would take for my order and they told me they messed up and would have to start all over again. But then they ended up finding my order, laying on a counter in the back. You'd think after exchanging looks with the workers so many times they'd think to just hand me my order since I was only sitting 5 feet away from them. My pizza wasn't even hot anymore by the time I ate it. I am never going here again.
author: Jayzel Ann R.

description: I normally order delivery here and tip the driver with no hassle but this time the delivery guy became impatient and yelled at me by phone to pick up my pizza. Not only was this completely inappropriate and no way to treat a customer, but I was completely appalled by the way he handled the situation. Yes, I was taking a nap and did not hear the delivery guy smashing away at my door knob. Personally, I would have CALMLY called the customer and CALMLY notified them that they were at the door. Instead, this guy used a very hostile and unprofessional tone of voice asking whether I was home or not and demanded an explanation as to why I was not answering my door. I was extremely shaken up and was rudely awaken from my slumber. I regrettably tipped the guy for the "inconvenience" I bestowed upon him. Hands down, the worst customer service experience ever. I also asked for two garlic sauces and they ended up giving me one garlic and one pizza sauce .....
author: Erica A.

description: Best Papa Johns around!  Most franchises have horrible service, but their staff makes it feel like a family-owned business.  Pizza is great and I will definietly be coming back!
author: Naji E.

description: I used the Groupon today, everything  was soo good ,excellent customer service .
author: a c.

description: tasty alternative for other late night pizza delivery , i picked mine up which happened to take a little longer than the promised 15minute, the manager and another employee apologized, and through in a free pack of its it ice cream, im a fan of their crust and pizza sauce , so far ive only tried the works, have to try some more of their specialty pizzas.
author: Wei W.

description: its not a chicago deep dish or a new york pizza, but truthfully, this is just perfect for when i am looking for "pizza"
author: Roy L.

description: so this is a fairly new location and the first for san francisco(though barely) being in park merced. i definately loved this place when i grew up in la and then when i moved back for a year. the pizza has this unique sweet sauce and the garlic butter is a nice touch, the prices are right and they are currently giving away free it's it ice creams with extra large pizza orders, it's pretty awesome having this in the city now, though it would have been nicer if they showed up about 5 years ago when i lived in park merced.
author: Sean B.
